intro: Lepidagathis incurva var. aristata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
